title: clicking on `<a download />` prevents subsequent `beforeNavigate` from running
body:
### Describe the bug

When navigating page I want to maintain certain query params and I handle this in my `beforeNavigate`. I have an a tag with the download attribute which shouldn't route, but after clicking it still fires the `beforeNavigate` This download is technically external and it causes the url to not maintain the query params in the url. I also tried adding data-sveltekit-reload to the a tag and still got the same results. It didn't appear to work. This is a confirmed issue on my local machine.

### Reproduction

[Stackblitz Reproduction](https://stackblitz.com/edit/sveltejs-kit-template-default-jsjmtj?file=src%2Froutes%2F%2Blayout.svelte&terminal=dev)

Sveltekit maintains the params in the search bar, but not in sveltekit itself. Most of what you're looking for will be in the console under $page.url.search

1. Ensure the is a query param of `appKey=12345`
2. Click around the 2 pages and you can see that it maintains the query params in the console from `$page.url.search`
3. after clicking the PDF download button it downloads the pdf and then runs the `beforeNavigate` function (This is when I would expect it not to navigate)
4. Clicking to another page will not maintain query params in `$page.url.search` as the got wiped away from the faulty navigate.

### Logs

_No response_

### System Info

```Shell
System:
    OS: Windows 10 10.0.19044
    CPU: (16) x64 11th Gen Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-11800H @ 2.30GHz
    Memory: 33.15 GB / 63.73 GB
  Binaries:
    Node: 16.13.1 - C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.EXE
    npm: 8.1.2 - C:\Program Files\nodejs\npm.CMD
  Browsers:
    Edge: Spartan (44.19041.1266.0), Chromium (110.0.1587.50)
    Internet Explorer: 11.0.19041.1566
  npmPackages:
    @sveltejs/adapter-auto: next => 1.0.0-next.91
    @sveltejs/adapter-node: 1.0.0 => 1.0.0
    @sveltejs/kit: 1.5.0 => 1.5.0
    svelte: ^3.54.0 => 3.55.0
```


### Severity

serious, but I can work around it

### Additional Information

This has been tested locally and on stackblitz. The same result occurs.
